body_content.explanation: grains of a substance that you dissolve in bath water to make it smell pleasant or to make your skin soft:
examples: A jar of lavender bath salts was by the tub.
Use only plain water—bath salt or soap may cause irritation.

body_content.explanation: a name for a synthetic (= artificial rather than natural) drug used illegally as a stimulant (= a substance that makes the mind or body more active):
examples: “Bath salts” are sometimes marketed as cheap substitutes for other drugs such as MDMA or cocaine.
The House voted for a bill that would outlaw so-called "bath salts" that are used as drugs.
